text: in 1953 chemist Stanley Miller and his
professor Harold Urey tried to figure
out how life got started on earth
and came up with a groundbreaking
experiment the two of them came up with
this idea that if you took a simple
mixture of ammonia hydrogen methane and
put an electric spark through it to
simulate lightning that maybe you could
make organic compounds that we
associated with biology it worked
Miller and Urey cooked up amino acids
the building blocks of life
years later Miller passed on his lab
equipment and research materials today
they're still shaking up the world of
science just before Stanley Miller died
I found out some of the material that
I'd gotten from his laboratory were all
these little boxes and I realized from
the nomenclature that was on it page in
his notebook that these were all samples
from his original experiments that he
did in 1953 so he had preserved samples
of this and had not told anyone he
hadn't told me and I found out later
he'd never even told his brother who
they were very close this is his
original writing by the way for those of
us at newsstand I mean we recognized his
writing right away by the time Banda
discovered the dozens of small boxes his
former professor was elderly and no
longer able to communicate it was up to
Bonner to figure out what the new
materials represented
so you can see here in this particular
vial there's just this little brownish
residue in the bottom of it and that is
the residue from the water flies that he
collected and even though it's such a
tiny little film and the bottom of this
it's more than enough we need to analyze
in fact when we first analyzed it but it
blew ours from its off scale there was
so much stuff there so we were able to
go back and look at his original
experiment and we found that these
experiments yielded far more of the
amino acids that he originally thought
it's a huge diversity of amino acids
that we've never seen before under noted
experiment in badas lab miller's
experiment continues to unfold with big
revelations just around the corner i got
about 200 of these little boxes or so in
the collection and we're slowly working
our way through these and we're on the
verge of making a new announcement in
the next six months or so about a new
aspect of this that we've discovered so
his experiment lives on over half a
century later
